item.title: Notes on properties of Gaussian process neural code
item.description: These are notes on properties of Gaussian processes relevant to their study as models of neural representations in the brain. These ideas and techniques were used in our work on statistics of place fields measured across a few different animal species, while they were navigating small and large environments of dimensions 1, 2, and 3. In the work, we showed the observed neural representations can be well explained in terms of threshold crossings of a Gaussian process, and these notes include how one can study structure of such threshold crossings of Gaussian process.
